results.title: In time of pestilence. The Pythoness
results.creator_credit: Joan Maude, John Halas, Michael Warne, British Film Institute and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Painter and poet: an experiment in words, music and paintings”.
The third part of a series devised by Joan Maude and Michael Warre incorporating the works of writers, painters and musicians to create an experimental animated film. This part consists of two short films. ‘In time of pestilence’ by Thomas Nashe, narrated by Robert Harris, drawings by Michael Ayrton (3:18 mins). ‘The Pythoness’ by Kathleen Raine, narrated by Mary Morris, drawings by Henry Moore (2:00 mins). Photography by W. Traylor and R. Turk, music by Matyas Seiber, edited by Jack King.

results.title: Winter garden. Sailor's consolation. Check to song
results.creator_credit: Joan Maude, John Halas, Michael Warne, British Film Institute and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Painter and poet: an experiment in words, music and paintings”.
The second part of a series devised by Joan Maude and Michael Warre incorporating the works of writers, painters and musicians to create an experimental animated film. This part consists of three short films. ‘Winter garden’ by David Gascoigne, narrated by Michael Redgrave, painted by Barbara Jones (2:17 mins). ‘The Sailor’s consolation’ by Thomas Dibden, narrated by Stanley Holloway, drawings by John Minton (1:40 mins). ‘Check to song!’ by Owen Meredith, narrated by Eric Portman, drawings by Michael Warre (1:10 mins). Photography by W. Traylor and R. Turk, music by Matyas Seiber, edited by Jack King.

results.title: Twa corbies. Spring and winter
results.creator_credit: Joan Maude, John Halas, Michael Warre, British Film Institute and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Painter and poet: an experiment in words, music and paintings”.
The first part of a series devised by John Maude and Michael Warre incorporating the works of writers, painters and musicians to create an experimental animated film. This part consists of two short films. ‘Twa corbies’ by anonymous narrated by John Laurie, drawings by Michael Rothenstien (2:24 mins). ‘Spring and winter’ by William Shakespeare, music by Dr. Arne and sung by Peter Pears, drawings by Mervyn Peake (5:40 mins). Photography by W. Traylor and R. Turk, music by Matyas Seiber, edited by Jack King.

results.title: Kip and David
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description: A thirteen part children’s adventure series made by Arthur and Corinne Cantrill about a young boy called David who meets a bushland elf while holidaying on Queensland’s Stradbroke Island and embarks on a series of adventures that highlight Australia’s wildlife and natural surroundings.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 13.
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Kip and David”.
Kip and David return to the island. The kookaburras, magpies and currawongs welcome Kip back and David feeds these wild birds. They explore a steep rocky gorge in which many Pandanus trees are growing and see giant turtles swimming. Kip and David watch the rock crabs feeding but the tide is coming in, so they leave the gorge and visit one of the ocean headlands. David promises to visit Kip whenever he can. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 12.
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Kip and David”.
Spring has arrived to David’s garden and Kip is feeling homesick for his island. David promises to take Kip back next time they return for a holiday. They set off to explore an old quarry, where they meet a geology student searching for fossils in the shale deposits. They find excellent fossils of plants and ripple patterns. David tries to use a geologist’s hammer and find a fossil to take home. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 11.
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Kip and David”.
Kip and David visit the plantation area of a bush sanctuary where they see koalas in the trees. David befriends the kangaroos. They observe emus sitting on their nests and inspecting the eggs. Some of the emu chicks have already hatched so Kip and David follow one of the emus with its brood of seven chicks as they move through the trees in the sanctuary. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 10.
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Kip and David”.
It is a rainy day and Kip and David play indoors. They decide to try potato printing and create some curtains. After the rain, they put the curtains up in Kip’s house. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 09
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Kip and David”.
Kip and David visit ‘Lamington National Park’ set high in the mountains. They see the rain forest with its giant trees, creepers, mosses and lichens, waterfalls and pools. They float leaf-boats down the small waterfalls, find a satin bower-bird’s playground and inspect the strange assortment of blue objects in it. Finally, they feed the wild scrub turkeys, bower birds, wild parrots and other small birds. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.

Episode number 9 of Series “Kip and David”.
Kip and David visit ‘Lamington National Park’ set high in the mountains. They see the rain forest with its giant trees, creepers, mosses and lichens, waterfalls and pools. They float leaf-boats down the small waterfalls, find a satin bower-bird’s playground and inspect the strange assortment of blue objects in it. Finally, they feed the wild scrub turkeys, bower birds, wild parrots and other small birds. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 08
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Kip and David”.
It is David’s birthday and Kip is the first to greet him, playing ‘Happy Birthday’ on his pipes. David is given a small microscope and some boxes of prepared slides. They look at some of these and then find things in the garden to inspect under the microscope. The postman brings another parcel, which contains an irrepressible Jack-in-the-Box. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
